results.title: Swann in Love = Un Amour de Swann
results.creator_credit: Volker Schlondorff, Nicole Stephane, Eberhard Junkersdorf, Margaret Menegoz, Les Films du Losange, Bioskop Film and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Based on one of Marcel Proust’s stories from “Remembrance of things past”, the film tells the story of Charles Swann’s obsessively jealous passion for the socially unsuitable Odette de Crecy. Stars Jeremy Irons, Alain Delon and Ornella Muti.

results.title: La Bamba (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Luis Valdez, Taylor Hackford, New Visions Pictures and Columbia
results.brief_description: Musical biography of Ritchie Valens, a poor Mexican-American who became a rock’n’roll sensation at age 17 in the 1950’s. Lou Diamond Phillips portrays Valens whose musical career ended when he was killed in the plane crash that also claimed the life of Buddy Holly. The music of Valens is performed by Los Lobos on the soundtrack.

results.title: Oliver (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Carol Reed, John Wolf, Romulus Films, Warwick and Columbia
results.brief_description: Perhaps the best loved of all family pictures, “Oliver” is a joyous and entertaining version of Dickens’ “Oliver Twist”. Mark Lester plays Oliver, the foundling who escapes the indignities of the workhouse to find success and happiness in the London underworld. Oliver’s new friends include the Artful Dodger and Fagin who teach him to “pick a pocket”. Star roles are played by Harry Secombe, Oliver Reed and Shani Wallis.

results.title: The Karate Kid (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen, Jerry Weintraub and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Daniel, a fatherless teenager, arrives in Los Angeles from the East Coast and faces the difficult task of making new friends. He becomes the object of bullying by a menacing gang of karate students, the Cobras, when he strikes up a relationship with the leader’s ex-girlfriend, Ali. Daniel’s handyman, Miyagi, a master of martial arts, teaches him karate and that fighting is always a last answer to a problem. Daniel learns that karate is a mastery over the self, mind and body, and develops physical skills as well as faith and self confidence.

results.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: the Movie (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Steve Barron, David Chan, Simon Fields, Kim Dawson, Limelight Entertainment and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: The four baby turtles who strayed into radioactive waste and mutated to become human sized talking reptilians with a hearty appetite for pizzas and rock music were raised by the Japanese ninja master water rat Splinter in the sewers of New York City. Now the dreaded Shredder is recruiting teenagers to commit a wave of robberies which has the city in panic. So it’s up to the four fearless turtles to save the day with a little help from feisty TV reporter April. Cowabunga! Based on the comic-book creation of Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird.

results.title: Twelfth Night (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Gorrie, Cedric Messina and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Felicity Kendall as Viola, this is a production of Shakespeare’s comedy of magic, romantic deception and foolish love. The film features a talented cast and remains faithful to the original text.

results.title: Atlantic City USA
results.creator_credit: Louis Malle, Denis Heroux, Selta Films and Cine-Neighbour
results.brief_description: The legalisation of gambling in Atlantic City brings about big changes in the life of an aging, smalltime numbers runner, especially when he meets up with a beautiful younger woman who entangles him with the Mob. Starring Burt Lancaster and Susan Sarandon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louis Malle, Denis Heroux, Selta Films and Cine-Neighbour

results.title: Crocodile Dundee (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Peter Fairman, John Cornell, Rimfire Films, Hoyts and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A New York reporter is intrigued by stories of an Australian crocodile hunter (Paul Hogan) and accompanies him on a journey through the bush. She entices him back to Manhattan, where his very outback Australian approach to the dangers of a big city, make him a success in New York society.

results.title: The Wrong Man
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Herbert Coleman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A tense thriller based on the true story of an honest man mistaken for an armed robber. When Christopher Balestrero (Henry Fonda) decides to borrow money on his wife’s insurance policy to pay urgent debts, a tragic chain of events is set off because the staff of the insurance company believe him to be a man who previously held up their office.

results.title: Manon des Sources
results.creator_credit: Claude Berri, Gerard Brach and Renn Productions
results.brief_description: Second and concluding part of the story based on the novel by Marcel Pagnol that began with “Jean de Florette”. This part, taking place ten years later, deals with the revenge inflicted by Jean’s daughter on those responsible for his death. An absorbing tale that makes its leisurely way to an unexpected climax. Stars Daniel Auteuil, Yves Montand and Emmanuelle Beart.
